com.futurice.cascade.i

Interface ICancellable

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    IAltFuture<IN,OUT>, IRunnableAltFuture<IN,OUT>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AltFuture, SettableAltFuture

    public interface ICancellable
    Stop an ongoing activity early if it has not already completed. Long running tasks such as IAltFuture must periodically check isCancelled() and terminate early. This is a cooperative mOnFireAction replacing more agressive techniques such as Future.cancel(boolean) and InterruptedException which lead to erratic results due to real world limitations such as underlying stateful code which may not clean itself up properly.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean cancel(java.lang.String reason)
      A plain text reason must always be provided for debugOrigin purposes.
      boolean cancel(java.lang.String reason, java.lang.Exception e)
      A plain text reason and an exception that originally caused the cancellation.
      boolean isCancelled()
      Check if cancel(String) or a similar occurrence such as a Exception have brought the operation to a premature end.

    • Method Detail

      • cancel

        boolean cancel(@nonnull
               java.lang.String reason)
        A plain text reason must always be provided for debugOrigin purposes. This is carried forward through whay may be non-obvious asynchronous and active chain results. If the operation has already completed normally, this call may be ignored. A warning may be given to help clean up redundant cancellation.
        Parameters:
        reason -
        Returns:

      • cancel

        boolean cancel(@nonnull
               java.lang.String reason,
               @nonnull
               java.lang.Exception e)
        A plain text reason and an exception that originally caused the cancellation. This exception may be from upstream and so it the "indirect reason that happened somewhere else for why we enter the cancelled state". We do not enter an error state in response to this call.
        Parameters:
        reason -
        e -
        Returns:

      • isCancelled

        boolean isCancelled()
        Check if cancel(String) or a similar occurrence such as a Exception have brought the operation to a premature end.
        Returns:
